c74object.name: fl.lag~
c74object.digest: Delay vector type input by a whole number of frames
c74object.description: Frames are expected to be of a uniform length. The output is the same length as the input. If the input length changes then the internal storage is reset. The object can also be reset by sending a frame to the reset input. The start parameter controls behaviour when insufficient frames are stored. The underlength output indicates that insufficient frames are stored.

entry.name: /max_frames [int]
entry.description: Sets the maximum lag value in frames. Note that the internal buffer is reset when this changes.

entry.name: /num_frames [int]
entry.description: Sets the current lag as an integer.

entry.name: /start [enum]
entry.description:
[0] - pad [1] - shorten
Sets the behaviour when there are insufficient frames stored (as after a reset):
pad - output a frame of default values.
shorten - output the oldest input frame since the reset.
Note that frames at the reset input set the frame use for padding.
If the frame is too short or empty it is padded with the pad parameter.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.lag~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.lag~. When set to 0 fl.lag~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.lag~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
